data.title: Base Node Icon in Create New Node Window?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, Godot 2.1-beta

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Can we get the nice white circle icon for the base node next to it in the Create New Node window? We see it in the inspector, but not in the Create Node window. I think it really helps drive home that it's a useful node in some cases and can be used. Like it's not just a tree item to organize everything else.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: slicing operation for DVector/ByteArray/RawArray: Dvector.subarray()
data.body:
This PR is related to #5701

Adds a slicing operation to DVector:
`DVector<T>& DVector<T>::subarray(int from,int to)`

Adds the two binds necessary to appear as `RawArray.subarray()` in GDScript

data.title: Tool script doesn't compiles if it uses a singleton
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4 and Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

Some of my game objects have `tool` on their root script in order to show gizmos in the editor. However, since I use a singleton in them, they no longer compile and I cannot see the gizmos anymore.
Using `tool` in the singleton script doesn't helps.

Repro:
[SingletonCompileError.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/368194/SingletonCompileError.zip)
Open this test project, the error appears in the console.

data.title: On Error Can't Press F8 To Close Running Game Window
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, any Godot version

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If when I press play there's a script or debug error I can't press F8 to close the game window and get back to the editor. I think it would really help usability if we were able to quickly close the window by hitting a key press, instead of having to use the mouse and get the editors focus and then hit the stop button. Can't just click the X button on the window, either. This can really be a hassle if your game window is fullscreen because you can't get back to the editor at that point.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Press play with an error in your script or debug error.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Clicking GraphNode Crashes Game
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu MATE 15.10, Godot 2.1-beta

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I create a Node, add a GraphNode to it, save my scene, hit play. When I click on the GraphNode in the game it crashes. No debug information or anything on crash either.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a GraphNode, play game, and click on the GraphNode.

[Test2.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/368190/Test2.zip)

data.title: Hide Animation editor plugin button if no node selected
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64bit, Godot 2.1 beta 64bit
GPU: GTX 970 - driver version 365.19

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The Animation editor button should be hidden, if no AnimationPlayer node is selected. It can lead to idea you can use editor without the AnimationPlayer node. You can crash the editor doing this:
1. Create an empty scene (do NOT add node AnimationPlayer)
2. Create a new animation resource.
3. Copy Resource (gear icon in inspector)
4. Paste Animation (gear icon in animation player)

The other fix would be to disable Animation Tools icon if no node is selected.

data.title: Fix editor states saving, and remove related error messages
data.body:
Fix editor not saving the editor states when saving and/or running the edited scene, and remove the related error messages:

```
ERROR: get_section_keys: Condition ' !values.has(p_section) ' is true.
   At: core/io/config_file.cpp:114.
```

```
ERROR: get_scene_editor_states: Index p_idx out of size (edited_scene.size()).
   At: tools/editor/editor_data.cpp:331.
```

Closes #5756.

data.title: Editor not removing name from menu when plugin defining has_main_screen() (return true) and get_name() is deactivated
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot v2.1.beta.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Okay an EditorPlugin putting a scene as a child of its EditorPlugin node has one very big issue - it goes over top menus!!! That will not work for anything other than temporary popup dialogs, certainly not for any long-lived editor control. I still do not have complete information on how to properly make an EditorPlugin that uses the edit area used by 2D, 3D, Script, AssetLib. It's clear that defining has_main_screen() and get_name() are not enough here. For one thing there needs be a method the plugin can call to determine the appropriate parent to place the plugin's edit controls (as a scene). Overriding .edit() also isn't the solution here because edit controls like AssetLib don't edit a defined object type yet can still use this area.

Furthermore the editor automatically adds your plugin's name (the string returned by the plugin's overridden .get_name() method) to the edit mode (2D, 3D, Script, AssetLib) menu when it activates but does not remove it when the plugin is deactivated. This is most likely a bug since the plugin itself has no way to remove its name from that menu since the script itself never added it to begin with.

**Steps to reproduce:**
plugin.gd:

```
func get_name():
  return "MyPlugin"

func has_main_screen():
  return true

func _enter_tree():
  # plugin does not itself the name into the menu as
  # editor does this automatically when plugin activated
  pass

func _exit_tree():
  # the editor automatically added plugin's name
  # thus there is nothing to uninitialize to remove the name
  pass
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
(The above script should be referred by an appropriate plugin.cfg that references it)
When activated it will appear in the menu alongside 2D, 3D, Script, AssetLib (etc.) but when deactivated the plugin's menu name (string returned by overridden get_name() method) that was automatically added on activation is not correspondingly removed.

data.title: Inexact results with Visibility Notifier 2D
data.body:
Hello!
Looking for ways to stop the sound and collisions from nodes outside of the screen. I tried to use the Visibility Notifier 2D, but because of how inexact is the event with respect to screen and visibility notifier bound, making this node _useless_.

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot_v2.1_beta_20160712_win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
**Visibility Notifier 2D** don't emit signal when the complete bound with this node is inside screen.
Visibility Notifier should emit on_enter_screen signal when the **complete** bound is inside the screen, same with on_exit_screen but outside

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a scene, create a Visibility Notifier 2D, add a script for know when the enter/exit screen signal is triggered, make a camera 2D with current ON, scroll the camera leaving the Visibility Notifier outside or inside the screen.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/cx4xqzt3zb8d7we/vision_notifier.zip

Here is a video of this minimal example, notice how inexact is the emit signal from visibility 2d, for simplicity I moved the camera with sync scene changes and print a message on enter and exit screen:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/6guz29d86pbl8j7/2016-07-17_09-45-21.mp4
If you want to try the demo, enable sync scene changes and move the camera, look at console for enter/exit screen messages. The Visibility Notifier 2D is the same size as the Godot icon.

**Update: Possible duplicate:**
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4803
Then, What about make an option or expose a parameter for a more exact behavior?
If that is not possible, What alternative recommend @reduz ? Or I should implement the exact checks taking on account the viewport rectangle, maybe a collision bound on the whole screen?
I don't want my shoots emit a sound when hit something which is not visible on the screen or damage a popcorn enemy entering the screen and kill it outside.

data.title: tabContainer node : set_ignore_mouse(true) doesnt work with set_tabs_visible(false)
data.body:
Godot 2.1 beta
Is it possible to disable clicking on tabs of the tabContainer node?
I noticed that even if I hide it's tabs - they are still clickable. That is not how I want to use the container. I want to change tabs only via code

However I found that if you make the tabs invisible with set_tabs_visible(false)
set_ignore_mouse(true) is completely ignored and they are still clickable - even if not visible!

data.title: Keep debugger selected tab open when pressing the pause button
data.body:
This is based on the behavior of the stop button, which maintain the selected tab open(when using the  `Debug` > `Keep Debugger Open`).

Closes #5681.

data.title: Feedback on new flat editor icons
data.body:
Opening this issue to collect feedback and todos for @djrm regarding the (awesome!) new flat icon set have for 2.1.
- The resource icon should still be remade: 
  ![spectacle zb4463](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16900268/5bbb3960-4c20-11e6-803e-b0d201afcc71.png)
  Right now it even looks like Unity3D's logo, so changing that would be nice :)
- Grouping icons: They are fine already, but I'm not 100% convinced, it took me some time to understand that those were grouping icons (especially when seeing them in the SceneTree). I don't really have suggestions to improve it though, just thought I'd mention my opinion here.
  ![spectacle pe4517](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16900281/8d5de3c8-4c20-11e6-8d30-de2350b68a3d.png)
- Node groups icon: Same feeling, but again I'm not sure how best to convey the grouping notion. It's not bad as is, but if people have suggestions for improvements, go ahead :)
  ![spectacle cj4572](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16900285/ceda1cfe-4c20-11e6-982b-f03392121e5d.png)

Awesome work generally speaking though, Godot 2.1 looks so rad :D

data.title: get_as_text() works fine in editor but fails when exporting game
data.body:
On Windows 10, Godot 2.1 beta:
Somewhere in my game code I have this line:

```
my_game_settings.parse_json(file.get_as_text())
```

where the file has the path 'res://settings.cfg'. I am choosing not to save to user:// since this isn't a game save but something only internal.

**In the editor when playing the scene, it works just fine & loads the file with no errors.
However, when I build an .exe I get the error:**

```
ERROR: _File::get_as_text: Condition ' !f ' is true. returned: String()
At: core\bind\core_bind.cpp:1582
```

I superstitiously tried changing everything! It won't budge! Same error & I don't understand C++ to know why.

data.title: Code improvement: Grep Search / Editor Improvements
data.body:
Hey all, love the engine.  But, I've been having to use other software while using Godot to do things that i am accustomed to doing in other IDEs (IntelliJ, Eclipse, XCode, etc.)  

One of the biggest ones has been "Find Occurences".  I've been using Grep to find all occurrences of a code or the uses of a method.  Being able to quickly find these sorts of relations in the editor would be fantastic, like right clicking a method/variable and "find all usages".  (I know Godot doesn't have right-click, but you get the idea.)

Another would be multi-pane editing.  Only being able to have one GDScript pane open at a time (instead of side-by-side) cuts down on some productivity.  I have been having to keep a Notepad++/TextMate open at the same time with multiple scripts to look at them side-by-side.  

Additionally, the quick open (ctrl + shit + o) is great for Scenes, but it would be nice if it could search for file names of GDScripts as well.

Thanks for all you do, guys.  You're amazing.

For mods: tags to use on this post are probably  "feature proposal", "topic:gdscript", "topic:editor"

data.title: Corrections and additions to FileDialog
data.body: Exposed mode, access, filters, and show hidden files to the editor. Also, two functions to get/set the filter list.

data.title: Collision solver issue with some ConvexPolygonShape2D?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, Godot 2.0.4.1 and master HEAD.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Characters seem to get stuck in ConvexPolygonShape2Ds with a shape like that:
![cku5noj80](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16897840/747e95b6-4bbf-11e6-96c1-8d91d151de3f.png)
or that:
![spectacle m21132](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16897847/b5b6c5f8-4bbf-11e6-9260-82785e727e81.png)

Note that the same outline drawn as a _Concave_PolygonShape2D works just fine.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open attached project in the editor
- Toggle visible collision shapes
- Go to the bottom with the arrow keys, then run left or right in one of the tiles with the problematic collision shape
- See that you get stuck

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[convexpolygon_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/367597/convexpolygon_bug.zip)

data.title: Ability to declare groups
data.body:
Similar to physic layers, I would like to be able to pre-declare groups, so I can see the list when I want to add one to a node in the editor. Currently, I used groups in my project but to remember them I have to dig in the scenes where I used them, sometimes I make typos and loose time debugging this. Having a list would be handy (even more for non-coders) and reduce errors made in the editor.
I currently centralize group names in an auto-load script so I have auto-completion when writing code, but it's not very useful in the editor.

data.title: Connection icon glitch
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

What happened:
When I click the connections icon next to the nodes in the scene tree, the Nodes dock is focused and shows connections. However, if I click another node's connection icons, the Node dock doesn't updates. The scene tree also shows the node as selected in addition to the ones that were already selected.

What was expected:
update the Node dock and unselect last nodes (or don't modify the selection, because we clicked the icon, not the node itself).

Video showing the behaviour:
[ConnectionsIconGlitch.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/367322/ConnectionsIconGlitch.zip)

data.title: Code editor improvement: highlight singletons
data.body:
I just discovered that it's possible to use auto-load singletons by their names, as if they were global variables.

``` gdscript
PlayerSettings.load()
# Instead of this
get_node("/root/PlayerSettings").load()
```

It would be nice to have them coloured in the code editor because otherwise they look like variables coming from nowhere. Usually, you can look up for the definition of a member or class by searching the file, but if it's a global thing you don't know that by just looking at the code.

data.title: ImageTexture change Size in Editor no 2D preview update
data.body:
Changing the Size of an ImageTexture(Resource) in the Editor is not updating the  2D preview(you have to click on the sprite to update).

Adding this solves the issue.

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/resources/texture.cpp#L32

```
#include "core_string_names.h"
```

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/resources/texture.cpp#L140

```
emit_signal(CoreStringNames::get_singleton()->changed);
```

I am not sure what " _change_notify();" does, maybe this has to be added too.

Is it even wise to change the size of an ImageTexture in the Editor?

I can't see any effect:
 1.The size changes are never saved.
   1.1. Saving the resource after changing the size is only saving the old size.
   1.2. Change the "ImageTexture" Size, press save resource, press save scene, restart project. the ImageTexture has the old size.
   1.3. Exporting to an TileSet with the new size is also using the old size.

If this is something that should not be used is it possible to hide the settings?

data.title: TextEdit: Scroll search results to the center
data.body: Closes #5269
